required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Evaluate the Effect of Food on LEO 152020
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomised, Oral Dose Trial to Evaluate the Effect of Food on LEO 152020 in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: A phase 1 trial in healthy people to evaluate the food effect on LEO 152020 in an open-label design using film-coated tablets

detailed_description.textblock: This trial will evaluate the pharmacokinetics and tolerability of 2 single doses of film-coated tablets in the morning after fasting or after a high-fat breakfast. The 2 doses will be separated by a washout period.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Single dose, cross-over with food effect

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 48 hours of each treatment period (Day 1 and Day 8)
pre-dose to 48 hours of each treatment period (Day 1 and Day 8)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve (AUC) from time 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0 inf)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of total adverse events (AEs) and number of subjects with AEs at each combination of treatment and period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of AEs per subject at each combination of treatment and in total

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs (resting blood pressure)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant changes in resting blood pressure (mmHq)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs (pulse)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant changes in pulse (beats per minute)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with clinically relevant changes in vital signs (oral body temperature)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant changes in oral body temperature (fahrenheit/celsius)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with laboratory abnormalities in chemistry parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant abnormalities in any chemistry laboratory parameters tested (standard units): Sodium, potassium, creatinine, creatine phosphokinase, urea nitrogen, calcium , alkaline phosphatase , aspartate aminotransferase , alanine aminotransferase , gamma glutamyl transferase , bilirubin, lactate dehydrogenase, cholesterol, triglycerides, glucose (fasting), albumin, protein, or tryptase

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with laboratory abnormalities in haematology parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant abnormalities in any haematology laboratory parameter tested (standard units): erythrocytes, hematocrit, hemoglobin, or white blood cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with laboratory abnormalities in urinalysis parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant laboratory abnormalities in any urinalysis parameters (standard units): protein, glucose, ketones, occult blood, leukocytes, or nitrite

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with abnormal ECGs
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal ECGs (maximum QTcF interval of ≥450 msec, or maximum change from baseline of ≥60 msec)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 48 hours of each treatment period (Day 1 and Day 8)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve (AUC) from time 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0 inf)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 48 hours of each treatment period (Day 1 and Day 8)
pre-dose to 48 hours of each treatment period (Day 1 and Day 8)

arm_group.description: Single oral dose given after a full breakfast
Single oral dose given in fasting state

criteria.textblock:
Key inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18.0-32.0 kg/m2 (both inclusive)
- In good health at screening and check-in as judged by the investigator based on medical history, physical examination, vital signs assessment, 12-lead ECG, and clinical laboratory evaluations.
- Pulse rate of 50 to 100 bpm at screening, or with minor deviations judged to be acceptable by the investigator
- Females of child bearing potential and male subjects whose partners are of child-bearing potential must also agree to use an additional effective method of contraception.
Key exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who do not, or whose partners do not agree to use effective method(s) of contraception from the time of the first dose until 3 months (90 days) after the final dose.
- Any surgical or medical condition which might significantly alter the absorption, distribution, metabolism or excretion of any drug.
- History of any significant infectious disease within 2 weeks prior to drug administration as assessed by the investigator.
- Subjects who have received any medication within 14 days of the first dose administration, except for hormonal contraception.
- Subjects who are still participating in a clinical trial (e.g. attending follow-up visits) or who have participated in a clinical trial involving administration of an investigational drug (new chemical entity), or a marketed drug within the past 3 months prior to the first dose.
- ECG abnormalities at screening or check-in
- Heart rate of <50 or >100 beats per minute, unless the investigator judges the subject to be eligible for inclusion.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified IPD can be made available to researchers in a closed environment for a specified period of time.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data is available to request after approval of the studied indication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data-sharing is subject to approved scientifically sound research proposal and signed data-sharing agreement.
